name: Demo Angular App
tagline: Demo app with best practices for angular 1.x
body:
# VTS GUI Coding Guidelines ## Summary This will provide the basis for organization, structure and best practices for an AngularJS 1.x application. This guide borrows heavily from John Papa's (@johnpapa) guide, which can be viewed here: https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-styleguide/blob/master/a1/README.md ## Table of Contents 1. [Naming Conventions](#naming-conventions) 1. [Project Organization](#project-organization) 1. [Modules](#modules) 1. [Controllers](#controllers) 1. [Services](#services) 1. [Directives](#directives) 1. [Tests](#tests) ## Naming Conventions All naming should describe the specific component or file being used. ### Components - Controllers and Services should be named in Pascal case and suffixed with their respective component type. > ExampleCtrl, SomeTestSvc - Module names should be camel cased. `angular.module('someTestApp', []);` - Submodules should be prefixed with their parent module using dot syntax. `angular.module('app', ['app.routes']);` - Directives should be prefixed to avoid collisions with future html or angular specs. `.directive('vtcCarousel', vtcCarousel) ` ### Files - All files should be lowercase and hyphenated for each cased word. - For Angular files, suffix the file with the type of component it is. > 'ExampleCtrl' should be named example.ctrl.js 'SomeTestSvc' should be named some-test.svc.js 'app' module should be named app.module.js - Submodules should leave out the prefix during file naming. > 'app.routes' should be named routes.module.js - Config blocks should be named based off of their module name. > 'exampleModule' should have a config file named example-module.config.js ## Project Organization - There should be a working directory for app development and a directory specific for dist. - Inside of the working directory, there should be a folder for features of the project. This folder contains subfolders for all the features and each feature should have it's own module. - All of the components (controllers, services, config, etc.) and markup (html) of the module should be kept in the specific feature's directory. - Each component should exist in it's own file independent of other components. The only exceptions would be including run blocks after a config or providers with config. - Each angular component file should be wrapped in an IIFE (Immediately Invoked Function Expression) to avoid pollution to the global scope. Additionally, use strict mode inside of each angular component file. ```javascript (function() { 'use strict'; })(); ``` ## Modules - Modules should be defined with setter syntax. `angular.module('app', []);` - Modules should be retrieved with getter syntax. ```javascript angular .module('app') .controller('AttachedToAppCtrl', AttachedToAppCtrl); ``` - Pass in named functions to components so they are easier to read and debug (as shown above). ## Controllers - Controllers should be used as 'the glue' between your view model. Logic in controllers should be extracted and placed inside of a service. - Use the 'controller as' syntax for views. Explicit naming in the view allows easy identification of a controller context, especially when controllers are nested. ```html

{{ SomeCtrl.title }}

{{ NestedCtrl.value }}

{{ SomeCtrl.valueFromParent }}

``` - Use the ui-router to assign controllers to views. If no route is associated with the view, then use the above 'ng-controller' directive. ```javascript .state('app.home', { url: '/home', templateUrl: '/home.html', controller: 'HomeCtrl', controllerAs: 'HomeCtrl' }); ``` - Use 'controller as' syntax for controller js by binding 'this' to a variable (this isn't used directly because of lexical issues in javascript). This helps prevent the urge to bind everything to $scope. ```javascript angular .module('app.home') .controller('HomeCtrl', HomeCtrl); function HomeCtrl() { var vm = this; //vm is short for view model } ``` - Bindable members should be kept at the top with function definitions placed below in alphabetical order for readability. - An 'activate' or 'init' function should be specified for controllers that need to perform work upon initialization. ```javascript ExampleCtrl.$inject = ['SomeSvc', 'FilterSvc']; function ExampleCtrl(SomeSvc, FilterSvc) { var vm = this; vm.filteredItems = []; vm.items = []; vm.value = ''; // binded functions vm.doTask = doTask; vm.filterItems = filterItems; activate(); function activate() { SomeSvc.doSomethingInitially(); } function doTask() { vm.value = 'Task completed'; } function filterItems() { vm.filteredItems = FilterSvc.filterItemList(vm.items); } } ``` ## Services This is the services section. ## Directives This is the directives section. ## Tests This is the tests section. ### Authors and Contributors Mike Labus (@mlabus93)
